string_table.str: We're halfway there, Jerome. Let's make sure it goes our way.
Keep going, we're halfway there!
I'm losing control, Jerome! We need to stop the Banished from holding those Towers!
The Banished nearly have full control! Take back some of those towers before they lock me out for good!
The Banished are going to take control unless we take some of those Towers!
I've nearly got full control! Make sure you hold those towers until I'm finished!
We've nearly done it, just hold those towers a little longer!
We've got control over all the Towers, let's make sure we hold them until I'm done!
Hold those towers, Jerome. I've nearly got full control now!
The demon has taken a Wraith! Stop it!
Humans! Wipe them out!
Where are our Hornets?
Impressive work, Spartan. Taking the Control Towers won't be a problem now.
Ooh-Rah!
Ooh-Rah!
Ooh-Rah!
Coming in now, sir.
Okay, listen up, team. You've all been chosen for this mission because you've seen plenty of action.
We can't send a large force in without alerting Atriox to our presence so I need the best.
Airpads allow the production of air units.
Move infantry units nearby capture points and press @TutAttack@ to capture them.
Cyclops are strong anti-vehicle units.
Hornets are versatile anti-vehicle units with a vulnerability to ranged infantry.
Access leader powers by pressing @TutPwrRadial@ to open the radial.
Capture the Control Towers
Capture the Control Towers so the Professor can gain control over the elevator.
Clear the area of Banished troops
Clear the area of Banished troops so the lightbridge can be safely activated.
Gain access to the Cartographer
Explore the area to find a route through to the Cartographer.
Hijack the Wraith
Use Jerome to hijack the Banished Wraith using @Y_Button@.
Secure the elevator entrance
Get Jerome to the elevator entrance
Secure the elevator entrance to make the area safe for Professor Anders.
Get Jerome to the elevator to enter the Cartographer.
Keep your infantry units alive
Until you establish a base, you will have limited infantry. Keep them alive.
Use the Adrenaline leader power
The Adrenaline leader power increases the movement speed of all non-hero infantry units.
Use the Archer Missile leader power
Archer Missiles used:
The Archer Missile leader power launches missiles from the Spirit of Fire. Access the leader power radial by holding @TutPwrRadial@.
Build Hornets
Hornets built:
Hornets are effective anti-vehicle units. Build 10 Hornets at the Airpad.
Kill squads with a hijacked vehicle
Squads killed with hijacked vehicle:
Use Jerome to hijack enemy vehicles with @Y_Button@ and turn the tables on the Banished.
Hold 3 Control Towers at once
Capture and hold all 3 Control Towers at once to maximise the speed the Professor can access the elevator.
Destroy vehicles using Hornets
Hornet vehicle kills:
Destroy vehicles with a Cyclops
The Cyclops is an effective anti-vehicle unit. Build Cyclops at the Barracks and use them to destroy 20 enemy vehicles.
Cyclops vehicle kills:
Deploy Lotus Mines
Lotus mine deployed:
Lotus Mines are effective against infantry units. Deploy Lotus Mines 4 times.
Finish with a 1000 point advantage
Gain access to the Cartographer with a 1000 point advantage over the Banished.
Destroy the Banished's vehicle Foundries
Destroy the Banished's vehicle Foundries to slow the Banished's Wraith production.
Reactivate the lightbridge
Reactivate the lightbridge so the rest of the units can cross.
Recon the area
Recon the area as you make your way towards the elevator.
Build an Airpad
Build an Airpad so you can start building Hornets.
Build a Supply Pad and Generator
Build a Supply Pad and Generator so you can start producing supply and power resources.
Reactivate the lightbridge with Jerome
Establish a forward base
Establish a forward base so you can start building a force large enough to take on the Banished.
Destroy the Banished base
Destroy the Banished base to limit their unit production and make it easier to capture and hold the Control Towers.
Destroy the hidden facility
Destroy the Banished hidden facility to slow their units on the field.
Capture and hold it so I can start working on the elevator.
Jerome, I'm starting to make progress on the elevator, but if you captured the other control towers I'd be able to work faster.
I nearly have full control, make sure you keep hold of those towers!
Jerome, the Banished are taking back one of the towers! If we can't unlock that elevator we'll never get to the Cartographer!
That's it! We're in!
That's it! I've unlocked the elevator!
You're almost there, Spartan, but be careful. The Banished won't give up that elevator without a fight.
Jerome, we've already established a baseline of resources.
Upgrade your Generator now to an Advanced Generator.
Upgrading a Generator or building additional generators will also advance your tech level, allowing you to recruit more advanced units, buildings and upgrades.
Now you've reached a higher tech level, you have access to an Airpad. Build one now.
You now have a Generator which provides you with a steady power income, but you're going to need more to help you capture those towers.
Now start pushing out to capture those control towers while the enemy is regrouping.
J
Isabel, update the Professor with anything she needs to know about the Forerunner control towers.
We're dropping in a base now. The Professor will brief you on your mission while you wait.
You should also request an airpad so you can start building air units.
We already know the Banished have Wraith tanks in the area, so you'll need air units to effectively counter them.
Keep in mind that air units are vulnerable to ranged infantry, so make sure you're using the right unit for the right job.
Negative. It sounds like we have another party in the mix. Be careful, the enemy of our enemy is not necessarily our friend.
J
You can call in lotus mines to defend the captured towers.
Good work, Spartan. Each foundry you destroy diminishes the number of Wraiths you'll face in the field.
You're losing ground, Spartan. We need to turn that around.
Jerome, I'm sending in support to help you take those control towers.
Sabotaging those buildings will slow the enemy's ability to produce wraiths. It could give us the edge we need.
Get some Hornets down there now to counter those Wraiths!
There's more enemy units dropping in from the east, Spartan.
Hostiles incoming from the north!
It looks like that was the last drop for now, but they'll be back. Remember you can build Hornets at your Airpad to replace any you've lost.
Get those Hornets ready, Jerome. Here they come!
To open it up, I need you to capture three Forerunner control towers near the elevator. I'm marking them on your map now.
Capturing these towers will get me access to the elevator controls.
The Banished won't want us reaching the Cartographer, so they'll fight hard to keep control of them.
The more towers you hold, the faster I can take control.
We've failed. They've permanently shut down this approach to the Cartographer. Captain says return to the ship, we need another plan.
The gate's opening, Spartan. Hold those points!
The only way to access the Cartographer is by way of an elevator the Banished currently have on lockdown.
Remember, each tower you hold will increase the speed that I can take control.
The Banished will be after them as well. If they succeed, we won't be able to get to the Cartographer!
You're going to need a bigger army to capture those towers, Spartan. Build a Supply Pad and Generator first so you have a steady income of resources.
We've failed, Spartan. They've permanently shut down this approach to the Cartographer. Return to the ship, we need another plan.
Send in a Nightingale to collect the bodies, Isabel. We need to abort the mission.
Good work, team. We've got a clear route to the Cartographer now and you hurt the Banished's Wraith production at the same time.
I
Scout out the area. The Banished may still have troops moving along routes near the Cartographer.
Feels good to have a win, sir.
Yes! That was the last one. That'll put a serious dent in their Wraith production.
T
Looks like the Ark will only tolerate so much abuse before launching sentinels to defend itself.
It's a massacre! Anyone that could do this to the Banished isn't someone we want to run into.
Well, well. What do we have here?
I don't think that's their only facility. I'm detecting several similar structures in the area.
Captain, we're detecting enemy units moving on Jerome's position!
I'm across. Activating the lightbridge now.
Understood, sir. Let's take those towers, troops.
Professor, we've reached one of the Control Towers.
Spirit of Fire Actual, we've found a Banished base.
Your priority is capturing those Control Towers, Jerome, but taking out that base would help. It's your call, Spartan.
Agreed. But whatever happened here we still have a job to do. Let's keep moving.
Spirit of Fire Actual, we have established a base.
The Banished won't let us walk right into the Cartographer, so let's set up a base and build our assault force before we knock on that door.
We've taken one of the Control Towers, let's make sure it stays ours while we take the others.
Banished vehicles! Send in our Cyclops!
Spirit of Fire, we've found destroyed Banished mining equipment. Do we have another team down here?
Isabel, have you seen anything like this before?
Professor, the transport route gate is open.
Mind if I take this?
Wait here, I'll see if I can find a way around to get that lightbridge back online.
That's another Foundry out of action.
Spirit of Fire, we've reached the base location.
Spirit of Fire, we've found out who's been attacking the Banished mining operation here.
Looks like they were trying to keep this facility hush-hush. Let's make a mess of it.
This must be where they're manufacturing their Wraiths.
Spirit of Fire Actual, the Banished base is out of action.
Capture and hold Control Towers to increase the points in your Domination Bar. The side who fills the Domination Bar first wins.
Control Towers are key tactical points on the Ark. If a Control Tower already belongs to the enemy, you will need to liberate it first before you start capturing it.
To unlock a Leader Power to use, open the Leader radial by pressing @TutPwrRadial@
Select the Leader Power you want to unlock with @TutMoveCam@ and press @TutSelect@ to confirm.
Any active Leader Powers you unlock will be available to use from the radial menu.
Additional Leader Powers are unlocked by spending Leader Points, which you earn in battle.
Unit counters work on a 'rock, paper, scissor' system; Air units counter vehicles, vehicles counter infantry, and infantry counter air.
Cyclops are effective anti-vehicle infantry units.
@X_Button@ Capture
Each Control Tower captured increases your points in the Domination Bar. Fill the bar to accomplish your objective.
The Garage is now available, here you can build all of the UNSC vehicles.
@A_Button@ Activate Lightbridge
@special_power@ Hijack
@special_power@ Spartan Slam
Mini-bases are small outposts that allow you to build standalone buildings in one or two slots.
Spartans can also use the Spartan Slam to hijack vehicles. Move the crosshair over a vehicle and press @special_power@ to hijack it.
Press @special_power@ with a hijacker selected to Spartan Slam out of the hijacked vehicle.
Press @special_power@ to perform a Spartan Slam and reach the cliffside path.
Now! Mow the humans down!
Your bones will make fine ornaments!
